intro: Montanoa rekoi, commonly known as the Mexican mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Montanoa rekoi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
